medical_history.chief_complaint: Dull upper quadrant abdominal pain in a band-like distribution.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 14 days prior to admission, with pain described as moderate at its worst and intermittent. The pain improved with morphine and was not aggravated by any specific factors. Patient also reported chills for 5-6 days, non-bloody emesis once, dark urine, and poor oral intake for 3 days. No fever was reported.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Liver carcinoid tumor status post resection, remote history of cholecystectomy, hypothyroidism, history of UTIs, De Quervain's tenosynovitis, diet-controlled diabetes mellitus.
